instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-2915: What is 820-2915? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PP3V3_S5: What is PP3V3_S5? PP3V3_S5 is a 3.3v power rail when the system is in an S5 soft off power state.
definitions.SMC_ONOFF_L: What is SMC_ONOFF_L? SMC_ONOFF_L tells the computer that the power button has been pressed when it is low, _L means signal is asserted when it is low voltage. .
definitions.SMC_RESET_L: What is SMC_RESET_L? SMC_RESET_L puts the SMC into reset mode when it is low, _L means the signal is present when voltage is low. The SMC being in reset mode keeps it from running..
definitions.PP5V_S3: What is PP5V_S3? PP5V_S3 is a 5v power rail present when the system is in an S3 suspend to RAM state..
definitions.SMC_BC_ACOK: What is SMC_BC_ACOK? This is identical to CHGR_ACOK. This will come out of the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging chip when CHGR_ACIN & CHGR_DCIN are present, and is necessary for the onewire circuit to begin working. On most Macbooks, CHGR_ACOK needs to be present in order for PP3V42_G3H to flow to the onewire circuit so that the circuitry that allows the charger to communicate with the SMC will turn on.  .
definitions.PM_BATLOW_L: What is PM_BATLOW_L? PM_BATLOW_L is a signal that tells the system the battery is too low for it to turn on & keeps it from turning on, when it is low. _L means the signal is asserted when its voltage is low. .
definitions.SMC_ADAPTER_EN: What is SMC_ADAPTER_EN? SMC_ADAPTER_EN enables the machine to work off of the power adapter when the proper power adapter is attached. Attacching an 85w Macbook Pro 15” power adapter to a 13” Macbook that requires a 60w power adapter is ok, attaching a 45w Macbook Air power adapter to a 15” macbook Pro that needs an 85w power adapter will result in SMC_ADAPTER_EN missing. .
definitions.PM_DSW_PWRGD: What is PM_DSW_PWRGD? The "PM_DSW_PWRGD" signal in a MacBook stands for "Deep Sleep Well Power Good” and is required for the machine to power on & post..
definitions.3V3_SUS: What is 3V3_SUS? 3V3_SUS is an abbreviation for PP3V3_SUS. These are interchangeable. The "PP3V3_SUS" rail on a MacBook logic board is a power rail that provides a 3.3-volt supply to the suspend-to-RAM (S3 state) components. .
definitions.PCH_DSWVRMEN:
What is PCH_DSWVRMEN? DSWVRMEN stands for DeepSx Well On-Die Voltage Regulator Enable. This signal enables the internal DSW 1.05 V regulators and must be always pulled-up to PPVRTC_G3H 3.3 volts.
If this signal is not being asserted (i.e., not enabled), the on-die voltage regulators responsible for supplying power in deep sleep states may not be active. This could lead to the MacBook failing to exit from a deep sleep state or having issues when trying to enter one, contributing to a scenario where the device does not power on.

If the signal is not present or not at the correct levels, it could indicate a problem with the Platform Controller Hub (PCH) itself..
definitions.ADAPTER_SENSE: What is ADAPTER_SENSE? This is a line between the onewire circuit and the magsafe charger where the magsafe charger can talk to the SMC(system management controller) on the SYS_ONEWIRE line..

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
Hello

Replaced <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> and <TRANSISTOR>Q7080</TRANSISTOR> and same, (only turn on with battery)

With charger only:
NO GREEN LIGHT
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL>: 12.55V
<SIGNAL>SMC_RESET_L</SIGNAL>: 3.4V
<SIGNAL>SMC_BC_ACOK</SIGNAL>: 3.3V 
<SIGNAL>PP3V3_S5</SIGNAL>: 3.3V
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S3</SIGNAL>: 0V
<SIGNAL>SMC_ONOFF_L</SIGNAL>: 3.4V

Any idea?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
Forget to mention:
<CHIP>U4100</CHIP> was out of position (I dont know what they were trying) so I removed it and put in position some caps and resistors around it.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message: This board doesn't turn on with charger alone, unless it is 85W for sure; check that.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
I doubled checked,
I tried with 2 known good [B]85[/B]W adapters . Also I have always used my PSU to turn on these boards without any issue. 
What should I measure? With or without battery plugged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
If battery holds some charge, board should turn on even with 45W charger.
Check <SIGNAL>PM_BATLOW_L</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>SMC_ADAPTER_EN</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PM_DSW_PWRGD</SIGNAL>, <SIGNAL>PCH_DSWVRMEN</SIGNAL> and <SIGNAL>3V3_SUS</SIGNAL> (charger alone).
Did you try known good DCIN board?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
Problem fixed. (Broken <SIGNAL>ADAPTER_SENSE</SIGNAL> trace on J9600)

Now I am getting 1 beep not video. 
(I have dissabled the GPU)

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
Did you remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11?
How did you disable GPU?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
I disabled it using dosdude method.  I thought the GPU whas the reason why I had no video, when plugged the speakers noticed the beep.
I tried resetting the NVRAM and same, tried with different RAM sticks and same.

Could it be BIOS issue?
As I mentioned,  <CHIP>U4100</CHIP>  is currently missing in the board. Could this be the problem?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-2915</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-B turn on with battery only (NO green light)
threads.message:
<CHIP>U4100</CHIP> is irrelevant here (firewire port).

Disable GPU again, I don't know if method used resists to PRAM reset.
Also remove <RESISTOR>R8904</RESISTOR>/11 before power up the board again.
